title: Religion Critic Stelome Vows to Shut All Churches if Elected Leader: "Places of Hypocrisy" - Tuko.co.ke
text: Religion Critic Stelome Vows to Shut All Churches if Elected Leader: "Places of Hypocrisy" - A Kenyan man identified as Dr Stelome has called out Christians for only believing in prayers and fasting without putting in work - He angrily said he will shut down all churches when elected as a Kenyan leader so that people can get to work - Stelome wondered when people who believe in pastors and are always in church praying get to work and build their lives [PAY ATTENTION: We Need your Opinion! Take 5-min Poll and Make TUKO Better Now.](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScq-otrn1gxAfj5qwGa5dC94idDtj7xdUc23m5gsoywQTnlZA/viewform) A Kenyan man identified on TikTok as Dr Stelome has criticised Christians as lazy people who only rely on prayer to help them rather than working hard. In a video shared on his TikTok page, the gentleman also failed preachers who lie to congregants and claimed he would run for gubernatorial position so that he could shut down all churches in [Nairobi](https://kiswahili.tuko.co.ke/tags/habari-za-kaunti-ya-nairobi/). Why Kenyans are not going to church Stelome also condemned parents who force their young kids to fast just because their pastor or husbands who have been 'brainwashed' are fasting. The problem with Christians is that you do not know your Bible and that is why you're being shifted all over and you don't know what you believe in," he said. He added that he has nothing against praying, fasting or paying tithes but urged Christians to also work. "There are no lazy people like Christians; that is why I was telling you to stop dating church people. Ask them what their plan is when dating, and you will hear them say they have left everything in God's plan. God has given you breath and life; how do you live that to God,' he added. Stelome also said Africa, despite having the most prayer warriors, is still poor and the most corrupt continent. "Prayers never work for anybody, you pray, and you go to work. You speak to God, and you go to work. But Christians want to do all that but not work. When are you going to work? Stop depending on men to tell you things from God. You can face Good personally. Churches have become business and that's why we are not going,' he said. Stelome also wondered what [American televangelist Benny Hinn was coming ](https://www.tuko.co.ke/kenya/521769-rachel-ruto-invites-popular-preacher-benny-hinn-nationwide-govt-sponsored-crusade/)to do in [Kenya](https://kiswahili.tuko.co.ke/tags/siasa-za-kenya/) after receiving an invite from First Lady Rachel Ruto. Watch the video below: Atheists complain about church noise In a different story, atheists in Kenya, in October [wrote to complain about a noisy church](https://www.tuko.co.ke/people/523913-atheists-kenya-complain-alleged-noise-church-write-letter-nema/) to the National Environment Management Authority (NEMA). The atheists said the PEFA church in Saika on Kangundo Road was disturbing their peace with its powerful loudspeakers. Harrison Mumia expressed concern about the disruption caused by powerful loudspeakers during night vigils and Sunday worship services. Source: TUKO.co.ke
